clinical_study.brief_title: G-Tech Feasibility Study for Early Detection of a Post-op Ileus
clinical_study.official_title: Measurement Of GI Myoelectric Activity In Patients At Risk For Or Who Have A Post-Operative Ileus (POI) - Monitoring/ Recording GI Myoelectric Activity For Early Detection of A POI

brief_summary.textblock: A feasibility study for assessing and recording myoelectric activity in patients for early detection of a post-operative ileus (POI) in patients who undergo gastrointestinal surgery and differentiating the myoelectric signals from those who have normal post-operative return of GI function.

detailed_description.textblock:
Group 1: Up to 100 subjects may be consented prior to surgery who are planned to undergo gastrointestinal surgery or a planned surgery that does not involve the abdominal cavity. The post-operative course will be assessed for both clinical symptoms and for myoelectric activity for return to normal GI function or the development of a POI in both populations.
Group 2: Up to 50 subjects who have undergone gastrointestinal surgery or surgery not involving the abdominal cavity may be consented post-operatively during their hospital stay for this study.

primary_outcome.measure: Myoelectric activity pattern in POI patients versus non-POI patients
primary_outcome.description: The resumption of motor activity in the stomach, small intestine, and colon post-operatively. The measurement is myoelectric signals measured at the skin surface similar to ECG recordings for the heart

secondary_outcome.description: Device related anticipated adverse events; such as, skin irritation due to adhesive from the skin patch.
Device success defined as the ability to record GI myoelectric activity following GI surgery.

arm_group.description: Record myoelectric activity in patients with a post-operative ileus.
Record myoelectric activity in patients without a post-operative ileus.

intervention.description: A patch is placed on the abdomen of the patient to record myoelectric activity.
